To begin with the define and discover stage we are going to start by understanding the objective of the assignment. Taken from the textbook, it states that the goal is to "Deliver a full valuation of Panera Bread for a prospective KKR takeover using DRIVER. Combine DCF, trading comps, and precedent transactions to produce an informed bid range while contrasting financial-buyer discipline with strategic-buyer synergies." 

To go over the snapshot and overview of data I have included the deal breakdown: 
•	Scale: ($6B revenue growing 8%) $900M EBITDA (15% margin), $400M net income across 2,100 stores; digital sales already 50%.
•	Market references: Industry P/E ~22x, precedent EBITDA multiples 12-15x, Chipotle trades at 35x P/E, McDonald's at 25x.
•	Capital assumptions: Industry WACC 9%, management wants 10% rollover, strategic bidders (Starbucks, McDonald's) are circling.
•	Growth levers: 500 new stores in 5 years, digital mix to 70%, dinner/catering expansion, early-stage international rollout.

There are four required models for this case: Multi-scenario DCF, trading comparables, precedent transaction and football field/triangulation 
From what we know, Panera is highly competitive and is considered digitally forward. Panera can be valuated over the idea that they are hoping to expand to 500 new stores and would like to use a digital optimization mix of 70%. 
For the represent phase, using the 9% industry WACC, we can calculate that there is a WACC base of 0.09 and WACC strategic of 0.085 and a WACC downside of 0.095. This justifies the idea that this business model is flexible and ready for the next phase of the DRIVER formula. 
Now I am going to move over to the implement phase. I asked google Gemini to give me the python code output. Moving over to google collab now I will walk through the outcome. 

Moving over to validate and checking the results of this case we can start off with a sanity check. Looking at the results of the DCF implied multiple. We got a result of 14.65. The transaction range of historical comparables deals in the industry is 12x-15x. So overall, the sanity check passes because the 14.65 is in the higher end of the historical range which shows that there is room for growth and Panera has a strong positioning. This model is considered robust. Next we can run a sensitivity matrix, using the WACC rang across the horizontal axis and the terminal growth range across the vertical axis. I had google gemini run this and this was the result: The sensitivity analysis confirms the valuation is highly reactive to small changes in the WACC and Terminal Growth rate, which is typical for high-growth DCF models where the Terminal Value contributes significantly to the total EV.
